title: Multi-focus - dog fur score differences 1 dotplot

content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A researcher conducted a study to investigate whether a certain dog food supplement is effective in promoting healthier dog fur in two weeks or less. The researcher randomly selected <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> dogs from the dogs at a large animal shelter for the study. At the beginning of the study, each of the <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> dogs had its fur rated on a scale from <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, with higher values indicating healthier fur. The dogs were then given the supplement, and after two weeks each dog’s fur was rated using the same scale. All other variables were held constant within the two weeks. The difference in the fur ratings (after supplement minus before supplement) was recorded, and the results are shown in the following dotplot. (a) Explain what a negative difference indicates in the context of the study.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. A researcher conducted a study to investigate whether a certain dog food supplement is effective in promoting healthier dog fur in two weeks or less. The researcher randomly selected <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> dogs from the dogs at a large animal shelter for the study. At the beginning of the study, each of the <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> dogs had its fur rated on a scale from <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, with higher values indicating healthier fur. The dogs were then given the supplement, and after two weeks each dog’s fur was rated using the same scale. All other variables were held constant within the two weeks. The difference in the fur ratings (after supplement minus before supplement) was recorded, and the results are shown in the following dotplot. (a) Explain what a negative difference indicates in the context of the study.

(b) Based only on the sample data in the dotplot, should the supplement be used to promote healthy dog fur? Explain your reasoning in the context of the study. Do not perform an inferential procedure.

The owner of the shelter will purchase the supplement for all of her dogs if the researcher can provide convincing statistical evidence that it is effective in promoting healthier dog fur in two weeks or less.(c) State, in words, the hypotheses of the appropriate test the researcher should use to investigate whether the sample data provide convincing statistical evidence that the supplement is effective in promoting healthier dog fur in two weeks or less.

(d) Assuming all conditions for the appropriate test are met, the researcher published a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of <math alttext="0.011" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.011</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for the test. Based on the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value and <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> would the owner of the shelter purchase the supplement? Justify your answer.

Consider a scenario in which dogs are randomly selected one at a time, with replacement, from the sample of <math alttext="25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> dogs until a dog with a negative difference in fur rating has been obtained. Let the random variable <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the total number of dogs selected from the sample when the first dog with a negative difference in fur rating is selected.(e) Calculate and interpret the value of <math alttext="mu sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the scenario.
(f) Describe how the scenario could be modified to make <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> a binomial random variable.
